body_html:
retrain.py only really depends on having tensorflow installed. So I think we can skip bazel entierly.

Just downloading it to your working directory should be enough:

curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r1.1/tensorflow/examples/image_retraining/retrain.py

From there you can just run it like any other python script. For me, this works without any trouble:

python retrain.py {add your args here}

Let me know if it doesn't work for you, but I think it should.

body:
`retrain.py` only really depends on having tensorflow installed. So I think we can skip bazel entierly.

Just downloading it to your working directory should be enough:

    curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r1.1/tensorflow/examples/image_retraining/retrain.py

From there you can just run it like any other python script. For me, this works without any trouble:

    python retrain.py {add your args here}

Let me know if it doesn't work for you, but I think it should.
